TopicTitle: Devnote Tuesdays: The Greener Pastures Edition

Articles.Content:
Anthony (Rowsdower): Looks like weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re at the end of the road, fellas. My time as your community manager has almost reached its conclusion. At the end of our business day on Friday, I will no longer be part of the KSP team. No, there was no drama. No beef was had and I certainly did not fly down to the office to challenge anyone to a lucha match. I made a difficult decision in order to follow a sudden opportunity that arose closer to where IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m based. Yes, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m declaring myself for this yearÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s NFL DraftÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ok that last partÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s not true, but that first part is.

I am extremely proud to have been your community manager. There is no other community out there in gaming .quite like the KSP community. Your intelligence, creativity, passion and willingness to help others is rivaled by no one. Judging by how the game has progressed, your commitment to excellence and ability to keep the team on their toes is a testament to why having a community and maintaining a back and forth conversation with your fanbase is more important than ever. In short, you rock! Never change.

I must also give our forum mods, our media team, everyone at KSP-TV and last but not least, all you modders out there all the props I can. To do do what you do and work as hard as you can at it, just for the pure joy of it all is more heartwarming than anything. Your work helps drive KSP farther every single day and everyone at Squad is well appreciative of your efforts.

Finally, to everyone at Squad, itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s been an absolute honor to work with you. You all have been nothing but excellent to me since the very first day I arrived. IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m no developer, but my opinion mattered. When it came to things more in my wheelhouse, you trusted my judgements. For both, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll always be grateful.

IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m going to miss being around everyone and IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m going to also miss being Ã¢â‚¬Å“That KSP GuyÃ¢â‚¬Â among the people I meet out here, but life goes on. Thanks for listening and good luck to whoever comes next.

Felipe (HarvesteR): Last week, the new drag and lift models got integrated, and early testing has started on that. Early feedback sounds very good so far, and based on my own subjective experience, flying does feel a lot better now. WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re far from done though, as with the new changes, new possibilities arise and must be accounted for. Cargo bays havenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t had much of a use until now, but with the new aero system, they will shield whatever is inside them from the airstream. This means more than reduced drag and reentry heat though. Wing surfaces placed inside (closed) bays wonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t function, neither will parachutes, RCS blocks, solar panels, air intakes or science experiments which must be performed in an atmosphere. To get those to work again, you will have to open the bays first. These parts which were mostly just for show so far should now become a much more important (and useful) consideration when building.

Alex (aLeXmOrA): Still working on the KerbalEdu License system tweaks I have to do. Trying some programming languages IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m not familiar to, so I can make it work better and smoother. Also, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m helping with other Squad projects (web development side). .

Mike (Mu): ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s been a week of fixing bugs and expanding the drag system. Some great responses/feedback from the QA team about it all. The design for re-entry and mach effects is coming along nicely too but my main focus has been performance and stability of the drag systems.

Marco (Samssonart): The KSP new demo is starting to take shape, now basically all of the sandbox restrictions are set, as for the restrictions that affect all play modes the only one IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m missing is having limited concurrent flights. The next step, which is arguably the most time consuming will be to create the new career mode demo, this is harder than sandbox because the current demo already has a sandbox implementation, but career will have to be done from scratch.

Daniel (danRosas): Been working on the final touches of the upgraded rig for the animations. Shoulders are moving a bit funky, but nothing grave. Should be fixed with a couple of constraints. Imported into the game two new buildings for revision, in order to bounce back comments to Nick. Same thing with the female version of the Kerbals, needs to be approved inside the engine, to move forward with the implementation. On the other hand, weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re considering making some adjustments to the production schedule for the buildings, in order to give them more priority for now.

Jim (Romfarer): This week iÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve finally gotten around to adding more of the planned design concern tests to the EngineerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Report. Weeks ago i was getting real concerned that the tests were too heavy on the cpu, so i had to apply some re-factoring on the algorithms and now, with half the tests implemented, it looks like a non-concern.

Max (Maxmaps): This weekÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s been all about working closely with our collaborators to make sure their parts of the update are delivered in time. Aerodynamics is now in QA and the Refueling system will be soon to follow. IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve also been neck deep in business meetings regarding the general running of our Studio and planning for the future.

Ted (Ted): In the past week the QA Team and I have got cracking with testing the major components of the aerodynamics overhaul. As is custom in QA itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s been a bit bumpy to start off with, but the progress that is being made is phenomenal and the bugs are dropping like.. well.. winged bugs that are no longer flying.

Additionally, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been working closely with RoverDude and Arsonide to support the development of their respective features for the next update. Things are looking great on their end and some of you may already have caught a glimpse of the Resource implementation thus far in last weekÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Squadcast.

Rogelio (Roger): Last week I told you about doing an image that will appear in game, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been playing around with some ideas, and modeling some assets to make the image composition. The new spacesuit is already modeled and textured, now Dan is rigging it, weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll show it .as soon as itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s finished.

Kasper (KasperVld): I got a lot done in all sorts of areas over the last seven days: small maintenance on the forums, contacting Youtubers and Twitch streamers, making arrangements to get a few new moderators who speak specific languages involved on the forums and the list goes on. As you may have read in AnthonyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s blob, he will be leaving us after this week and IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve worked closely with him to make sure things go as smoothly as possible until we can get a new CM drilled in the routines. Until such time, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll be taking over control of the social media channels and serve as the point of contact between you and Squad. Feel free to message me about anything you would normally contact Rowsdower for.

Edited February 4, 2015 by KasperVld

Wow, got here sixteen seconds after it was posted.

EDIT: So sad about Rowsdower...

Though, glad to hear the aerodynamics are (mostly?) completed. Definitely a new incentive to get back into spaceplanes (for me, at least). Also can't wait for the new animations!

. . . as soon as itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s finished.

Soon

Rowsdower it's been fun . See you space cowboy...
Sad to see you go Rowsdower, but I wish you the best of luck skill in your new position
Good having you around, Rowsdower! You will always be counted amongst "The Good Ones" at Squad.

Anthony (Rowsdower):IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m going to miss being around everyone and IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m going to also miss being Ã¢â‚¬Å“That KSP GuyÃ¢â‚¬Â among the people I meet out here, but life goes on. Thanks for listening and good luck to whoever comes next.

Sad to see you go, the community you've helped shape won't be the same without you. I know you'll do well with your new opportunities and wish you every success.
Best of luck Anthony on your career.

Finally, to everyone at Squad, itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s been an absolute honor to work with you. You all have been nothing but excellent to me since the very first day I arrived. IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m no developer, but my opinion mattered. When it came to things more in my wheelhouse, you trusted my judgements. For both, IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll always be grateful.

IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m going to miss being around everyone and IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m going to also miss being Ã¢â‚¬Å“That KSP GuyÃ¢â‚¬Â among the people I meet out here, but life goes on. Thanks for listening and good luck to whoever comes next.

Speaking for myself, I have to say that part of what made this community so great is that it has had an awesome Community Manager who has shown a genuine concern for the well-being of the community as a whole. I can't recall a single incident where your enthusiasm for KSP and the people who played it didn't shine through. As a member of the forum's moderation team, it's been a pleasure working with you.

Hope things go well as you pursue new and interesting opportunities in your life

Rowsdower, what can I say? You're what makes this community great, and what you have done for us is astounding. Thank you, sincerely, for all that you have done.

I wish you best of luck in the future.
Thank you Rowsdower for all you have done to make this community one of the best. Best of luck. Fly Straight and True.

Oh man, another CM leaving, that makes three so far.

Sorry to see you go, seriously, but I wish you all the best for the future, good luck and thank you for everything you've done here
Good luck Rowsdower!
Good luck Rowsdower! I hope that you will always look back fondly on your CM memories.

Max (Maxmaps): IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve also been neck deep in business meetings regarding the general running of our Studio and planning for the future.
Hidden gem right here.

Anyway, I'm going to miss you Rowsdower. You've slipped the surly bonds of Kerbin and touched the face of NFL.

Oh man, another CM leaving, that makes three so far.

Sorry to see you go, seriously, but I wish you all the best for the future, good luck and thank you for everything you've done here

Three? I only know Rowsdower and Capt' Skunky. Who came before him? (Or in between if I forgot someone)

Okay, after reading through everything over again to be sure, here's my opinions.

-Make sure there's fairings and not just cargo-bays.

-Will the suit models be in-game? If not, I don't see what the point of having IVA/EVA suits that you can see up-close that look worse in the actual game than they do on tiny little pictures in the astronaut complex. Now, I'm not suggesting implementing the 1000+ polycount model for the cinematics into the game, But having a better model in the cinematics than the game is inconsistent and leaves a bad taste in my mouth. Why make the suits for two-or-three minute long cinematics better than the thousands of hours seen on a Kerbal?

--It is possible, i suppose, that the re-rigging of the Kerbal's skeleton is evidence for an in-game remodel, but this is not obvious if true at all.

-Still excited to see female Kerbals.

Will they be forced to stay in their kerbal homes ti take care of the kerbal children?

Or when using them, will the risk of a crash elevate?

-I don't suppose the implementation of female Kerbals might add a bit of modding support to the Kerbals as parts/vessels? Perhaps changing the model or something? Would be wonderful for RealSolarSystem if a human astronaut could be substituted.

-The new demo ought to include the Aeris 3a, but no spaceplane hangar or other plane parts. Just allow you to fly a plane, no more, to make the full game even more want!

-I think the demo should either not include docking ports or not include more than a few flights, but not both. And I think the demo should definitely have docking ports. (So you can dock two ships together to make room for another!)

-The demo should have some structural parts.

-I might be a bit hopeful for having a demo with such freedom, but arguably there's more freedom in the equally free 0.13.3 demo. You can even mod the 0.13.3 demo. (Though I don't think the demo should be moddable or anything!) I feel that up to a certain point, the more features in a demo, the more people will want the full game, especially if those features themselves are limited. It's like giving you several potato chips instead of a single chocolate. The potato chip is less filling on it's own, but it makes you want more. Potato chip metaphors ftw!

-If the Kerbal models are updated, even if it is just in the cinematics, the Shapeways Kerbals might should be updated as well. This would perhaps even get a few more buys from people who want the updated versions.

-Ven's Stock Revamp.

-VEN'S STOCK REVAMP.

-VEN'S STOCK REVAMP.

-VEN'S STOCK MOTHER KRAKEN RE VAMP
